ARTICLE.TITLE: Ottawa Co. Announces COVID 19 Test Sites
ARTICLE.TEXT:
For those in Ottawa County who may be concerned about whether or not they have contracted COVID 19, a series of drive-through testing sites throughout the county have been set up.

by Gary Stevens

HOLLAND TWP., MI (WHTC-AM/FM) – For those in Ottawa County who may be concerned about whether or not they have contracted COVID 19, a series of drive-through testing sites throughout the county have been set up.

Beginning Monday from 3-7 PM on the Zeeland East/West High campus, the six sessions will be available for those 18 and older at no cost. The other sites and times:

Wednesday, April 19 from 3-7 PM at Holland Middle School on East 24 th Street

Street Saturday, April 22 from 8 AM-12 PM at Grand Haven Community Center (register at the Columbus-North 5 th parking lot, with the test off of Fulton Avenue)

parking lot, with the test off of Fulton Avenue) Monday, April 24 from 4-8 PM at the Hudsonville High Freshman Campus off of Allen Street

Wednesday, April 26 at Longfellow School on East 24 th Street in Holland

Street in Holland Saturday, April 29 from 8 AM-12PM at Holland Middle School on East 24th Street

Michigan National Guard members will conduct the tests, with Medical Reserve Corps volunteers and Ottawa County employees providing support. For more information, click here.
